verses.roman:
kimvā 'kānti'-śabde kṛṣṇera saba icchā kahe
kṛṣṇera sakala vāñchā rādhātei rahe

synonyms: kimvā—or; kānti-śabde—by the word kānti; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; saba—all; icchā—desires; kahe—says; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; sakala—all; vāñchā—desires; rādhātei—in Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; rahe—remain.
translation: "Kānti" may also mean "all the desires of Lord Kṛṣṇa." All the desires of Lord Kṛṣṇa rest in Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.
